divs: sighting detailswe were driving east on interstate 90\94 north of madison, wi on the morning of december 19, 2006 around approximately 7:30 - 8:00 a.m.. it was a clear sunny day. there were many plane trails in the sky. but there was one large stationary tan object in the sky to the east of 90\94. my friend said he thought maybe it was a star or a planet, but it looked nothing like a star. it was very, very large in comparison to all the planes in the sky. it looked like it could have been a blimp or a hot air balloon. as we drove down the highway we were getting nearer and nearer the object until we were right next to it. when we were next to it, it looked nothing like it had from a distance. it looked like saturn with a ring of lights around it. the ring of lights was white and pretty dim. the area above and below the lights was very faint and greyish looking. again it was very large. we also saw 4 or 5 other unmoving objects in a variety of distances away from this large object. suddenly the lights on the nearest large object just faded out. but then one of the other unmoving objects became visible and it looked exactly like the one that disappeared and was just as large. it did the same thing. it faded out from the position it was in, but i could see it or another object exactly like it to the north very faintly for awile after the 2nd one disappeared. this all took place in about a 30 minute time period. i kept saying i wished i had binoculars and a video camera with me. i have been travelling via car on the road for years because of my jobs and i have never seen anything like this. i am pretty positive that these were ufos. i am a sky watcher but am not sure what i saw. the most compelling part about this to me is that from a distance it was tan, large roundish, ovalish and when we were right next to it, it didn't look like that at all. it was not a plane, helicopter, hot air balloon, blimp, star or planet. it was too sunny and clear of a day for me to be confused about what i saw. i came to this sight because i felt sure there would have been many reportings about this that day. i have not been able to get this off my mind since it happened. i am 46 years old and have never experienced anything like this. now i know why they are called unidentified, because i do not know what i saw. i just know that it was extraordinary.
Summary: Witnessed a large unmoving object in the sky
trends: There have been 23 other sightings in Madison
There were no other sightings in Madison on or around December 19th 2006
